Sentence: The superconducting transition temperature (T c ) of the ultrathin NbN films used in HEB mixers is close to 11 , and this has limited the operational temperature of the NbN based HEB mixers to around 4.2 K. Owing to its high T c (â¼39 K) [5] and short electron-phonon interaction time (few picoseconds) , and fast phonon escape rate, MgB 2 has become a promising candidate for wideband HEBs with good sensitivity and higher operational temperatures.

The MgB 2 thin films thus grown showed high T c (22-39 K) and high J c (10 6 -10 7 A cm â2 at 5 K) along with a small surface roughness (R q ï â¼ï 2.6 nm) that is suitable for the device fabrication.
